/home.content:
Welcome, my name is Saskia de Groot. I enjoy my variety of professions: drawing, coaching and guiding. Read more about me using the link: I am ... or on my facebook page.

Drawing

 

Come and enjoy drawing in a cosy atelier. The groups are small and drawing experience is not necessary at all! There are workshops for children, adults and teachers.

Coaching

 

Tackle your challenges with insights from your own drawings. Or solve your mental problems permanently though the MatriX method.

Guiding

 

Surprise yourself by bike or on foot, in city or countryside with a very experienced guide. Or become inspired by one of the lectures.

/drawing.content:
Drawing general

In my atelier we are drawing artistically according to an holistic approach with a psychological touch. This results in drawings based on feelings and emotions. Fun and joy are most important as is the realisation that the results are always good! Especially when we realise it is the subconscious that strongly influences the art work. And our subconscious cannot be wrong.

There is room for up to 6 children or 5 adults. I offer interesting themes like 'Happiness', Self-confidence' or 'Shapes'. You might find artists like Escher or Hundertwasser inspiring as well. No drawing experience is required.

We use a variety of materials (colouring pencils, markers, fluid aquarel paint, gouache paint, bee wax crayons, East-Indian ink, lead pencils) on different kinds and sizes of paper.

See more:

  • Children
  • Adults
  • Teachers
  • Artwork

/drawing/kids.content:
Workshops for children

How and what?

Drawing workshops for children take place during school weeks. In groups of max 6 children they work on different themes. No drawing experience is needed.

Current offer

All workshops take place in atelier 'Saskia de Groot'.
Drinks, a cookie and materials are inclusive.
Afterwards an email is sent with info about the workshop.

 

ALL WORKSHOPS CONTINUE AT HOME THROUGH VIDEO CONTACT.

/drawing/adults.content:
Workshops for adults

Why?

Just a moment for yourself to be creative, to relax, to enjoy and to let your subconscious speak. Think of working in the style of artists like Escher or Hundertwasser. What about deeper psychological themes as: How full is my head? How strong do I stand? What place do I take within my family? Let yourself be surprised about what your drawing tells you!

Most artworks will tell you a lot, and where possible I will give you that feedback.

How and what?

Energetic drawing with different materials. The result is always good and no drawing experience is needed. At request workshops can always be organised for groups of 4 to 5 persons.
Most artworks will tell you a lot, and where possible I will give you that feedback.

Current offer

Drawing  Workshop “Poetry” for Adults
Tuesday 4 February 2020

Be inspired by a poem of choice. Drawing experience is not needed at all.
* 7.30 pm - 9 pm € 20.00 (incl coffee / tea)
*  in atelier 'Saskia de Groot'.
* €20 per person, minimum of 4 persons, 90 minutes.
* Coffee/tea, goodies and materials are inclusive.

Workshops on request are always possible.

/drawing/teachers.content:
Workshops for teachers and employees After School Care

Why?

Learn more about the 'stages and stories' within children's drawings. What should a child be drawing at age 8? Does the child show a social-emotional coherence with his age range? What does that house tell us in the drawing? Why does the child only use one colour?

How and what?

Curious?
I am keen on providing an interactive workshop during a study day. Very interesting, light, enriching and with drawing suggestions for in the classroom.
Away with the colouring sheets as sops!

Approach and costs

  • At location, groups up to 40 persons.
    From €150 ex VAT, 90 minutes to 2 hours.
    Including material, excluding travel expenses.

/drawing/artwork.content:
Some artwork...

Despite the fact that it is no goal in itself, some very interesting artwork is created during the workshops.

/coaching.content:
Coaching general

As a coach I will help you tackle, challenge or face a problem. This can be done through drawing: your subconscious will speak for you! Afterwards you and your coach will work together to translate the hidden story within your drawing. These newly found insights will be beneficial to your wellbeing. The ability to draw is not important: a scribble will be just as informative as any form of drawing!

Or maybe you prefer using the Matrix method instead: with this method your MatriX coach will help you retrieve negative emotions or experiences stored in your long term memory; your coach will help you to neutralise those feelings before filing them back into your memory. This MatriX method can also be used to teach you where to store information in your mind (learn how to learn) as well as how to declutter your busy mind on a personal level. You will see results in 2 or 3 sessions.

See more:

  • Drawing coach
  • MatriX coach

In my atelier you briefly work on a drawing assignment. After that we read the drawing together so you can experience what it tells you.
Curious why certain things never seems work for you? Frustrated because you are afraid of showing your true emotions? Wishing you had more self confidence?

This special offer allows you to step into the world of the drawing and its story.
During a coaching series you can work on matters, now you can discover already something!
Please contact me for an appointment at a time that suits you.

/coaching/drawing.content:
Drawing coach

For who?

  • Specialisation: children and teenagers
  • Adults

Why?

A drawing coach offers guidance to work on a goal or a request for help. It is also helpful to find out what you want right now when feeling lost.
How do I get more self-esteem? How do I make new contacts in new situations? How do I get over a fear? How do I learn to deal with a divorce?

How and what?

Together we will set a goal or sub goal. I will then use an induction (short story) to simulate your situation. After this you will start drawing or painting. The subconscious will show images on paper that we read and explain together. What do these lines mean on the left? What does a bird mean to you? How is that lion standing? Body work is an essential part of the coaching. Copy standing like that lion! Are you stable on two feet? What needs to be changed? Often something in the drawing will be altered or added, which will be a healing action. These insights together with related homework will make you take steps into the right direction.

Approach and costs

  • Coaching takes place in atelier 'Saskia de Groot'.
    €45,00 per session, a session takes 35 to 45 minutes including direct afterwards feedback.
    You will receive an invoice after each session (unfortunately, there is no coverage by health insurances).
    A series of 6 is recommendable.

Prior to the first session is an intake. This intake is for free. At the intake for a child a parent is also present, but after that a child draws alone with the coach. After each session the parent receives some short feedback. On request a more elaborate explanation can be given about the progress made.

/coaching/matrix.content:
MatriX coach

For who?

For children from ±8 years old and adults who have their own request for help.

Why?

The MatriX method offers a quick technique to get rid of fears, psychosomatic pains or unprocessed emotions. The MatriX coach will guide you through a mental process for retrieving negative emotions or experiences from your long-term memory and placing them back after neutralizing them. The MatriX method also works well learning how to learn (learn where to store information) or how to declutter your full head (according to a personal structure).

The MatriX method may help with:

  • dyslexia/dyscalculia
  • learning problems
  • trouble when automatising/​memorising
  • full and stressful heads
  • lack of self confidence
  • anxieties
  • fear of failure or other mental problems
  • traumas, PTSS
  • unprocessed emotions
  • negative future situations
  • psychosomatic pains

How and what?

The coach does not need to hear personal stories; hence the client does not need to share them. A simple 'My anxiety feels like a stone in my stomach' will often do as a starting point.

The strength of the MatriX method:

  • effective conversational technique
  • content of story will not be told
  • person central
  • short process: 2-3 consults
  • awareness of own mental processes and own solutions
  • effectiveness proven by research
  • innovating, practical, clear, concrete, uncomplicated, applicable

Approach and costs

  • Coaching takes place in atelier 'Saskia de Groot'.
    €60 per session, a session lasts 1 hour to 90 minutes.
    You will receive an invoice after each session (unfortunately, there is no coverage by health insurances).
    A second or third session is recommendable to consolidate the planned effect.

Links

  • MatriX method website
  • Example 'Decluttering your head' on YouTube
  • Example 'Learning how to learn' on YouTube

/guiding.content:
Guiding general

Together with a guide you will see things and hear stories you did not know yet. Let yourself be surprised in city or countryside, on foot or by bike. The possibilities are endless, so is the pleasure!

See more:

  • City walk
  • Bike tour
  • Lectures

/guiding/walking.content:
City walk

For who?

A group of friends, family or colleagues up to about 15-20 persons.

Where?

Cities in the Netherlands as Amsterdam, Utrecht, Alkmaar, Delft, Haarlem, etc.

Why?

Entertaining and interesting to hear stories about places you normally would miss, or just see that spot you never even knew it existed. History and stories make a city walk into an unforgettable experience.

Costs

  • €60 per hour (minimum of 2 hours).
  • Plus: Travel time to and from location (same as hour price).
  • Special day prices available.
  • For businesses a special price is applicable.

Current offer

 

CANCELLED Tuesday 17 March 2020  &  Saturday 28 March  - Amsterdam  (Engelstalig)
These 2 walks through the 17th century expansion of east Amsterdam will cover Jewish history. After arrival at Amsterdam CS, we will walk to the warehouses around the Entrepotdok, through the fancy Plantage neighbourhood and along the synagoges near the Waterlooplein.  These are all lovely neighbourhoods, with also horrible stories. We will stop for coffee and end at the Waterloo square. You may hop back on the metro to catch the train home at Amsterdam CS or stay for a little longer. Interesting might be visiting the Hermitage, Jewish Historical Museum, Botanical Gardens or the Rembrandt house which are all around the corner.
These walks will be my last group walks in Amsterdam. Per April 1st 2020 there will be a new permit system in the centre to reduce the number of tourists. This guiding permit is expensive for the few times I wish to walk in Amsterdam, ánd after payment obtaining the permit is not even garantueed.
So after April 1st 2020 I will continue to guide walks in Amsterdam, but only for groups of maximum 4 people.
* 9.00 am station Hilversum - about 12.30 pm Waterlooplein (direct train - walk - coffee - walk - end Waterlooplein)
* Departure Hilversum train station, return open
* Price: €20, to be paid in advance
* Participants: minimum 7 persons
* Including: Professional guide
* Excluding: train & coffee
* Bookings: contact@saskiadegroot.nl

 

Would you like to go on another moment, or with your own group? A personal request is always possible.

 

ALSO PERSONALISED AUDIO TOURS!

According to your wishes I will make a route and record audio comments at home.
You can then go by yourself whenever and with whoever and enjoy the sights with comments.

Please send me an email if you wish to receive my newsletter.

/guiding/cycling.content:
Bike tour

How?

As a very experienced guide I love to take you along. On the way you just follow and enjoy the story stops. Of course I love to answer your questions.
(A new development is me being your audio guide with a GPS route. Please contact me for more info).

For who?

A group of friends, family or colleagues up to 12 persons. Ideal for a weekend day or during school hours.

Where?

Cities and surroundings in the Netherlands. Amsterdam is great and very bike-able outside the busy centre. Cycling along the river Vecht, the Hollandse Waterlinie, through the flower fields, the Green Heart of Holland, Kinderdijk. It is scenic wherever you go!

Why?

You can see more by bike. No strolling, so less tired. With a rental bike or own bicycle. The Netherlands are beautiful! History, the landscape and anecdotes make a bike trip into an unforgettable experience. The guide can fix minor reparations on the bike when touring.

Costs

  • €60 per hour (minimum of 2 hours).
  • Plus: Travel time to and from location (same as hour price).
  • Plus: Bike rental (price depending on location).
  • When bringing own bike, it needs to be in good shape.
  • Special day prices available.
  • For businesses a special price is applicable.

 

Current offer

 

  • Saturday September  2020
    Bike tour Amsterdamse Bos (in English)

The train will bring us to station Amsterdam Zuid where we rent our bikes. In no time we cycle through the lovely laid out Amsterdamse Bos. A parc 3x the size of Central Parc New York. With 51 km of bike trails we can bike along the highlights and its stories; De Bosbaan, the goat farm, the lock, the old peat fields etc.

 In good company of international people!
We stop for coffee.
 

  • * 9:24am - 2pm (possibly half hour earlier/later)
  • * Departure and arrival train station Hilversum
  • * Price: €37,50, to be paid in advance
  • * Participants: 7-15 persons
  • * Including: Professional guide + bike (hand brakes + gears)
  • * Excluding: train & coffee
  • * Bookings: contact@saskiadegroot.nl
  •  

  • PERSONALISED AUDIO TOUR!

  •  

    Please send me an email if you wish to receive my newsletter.

     

  •

/guiding/lectures.content:
Lectures

For who?

Those who like to know more about the Dutch landscape, history, stories and tourist tips. Whether you are new to the country or a curious local who loves to learn more.

Why?

As a guide, I learned so many things about my country the past 25 years, that I am very keen on sharing this information with those who like to learn more. My enthusiasm will make you enthusiastic to go and explore for yourselves.

Approach and costs

  • At location of choice as long as a beamer or large display is available.
  • Subjects/themes will be composed on request.
  • The costs depend on location, duration and required preparation.

/whoami.content:
I am a ...

... Kids' Coach Drawing

The drawing tells a lot and that drew my attention. I specialised to become a Kids’ Coach through Drawing (June 2017).

... MatriX coach

I followed the training with Ingrid Stoop. I learned to help others in an effective and quick way, a style that fits my personality. Since October 2016 I am a certified MatriX coach.

... fan of Jung

In August 2015, I started a 3-year study with Stichting Odrerir: ‘Symbolical psychology of C. G. Jung’ which is the base of my theoretical background knowledge.

... Happiness Ambassador

The Dutch foundation “De Gelukskoffer” promotes her program to make children aware that 40% of their happiness is in their own hands. It will give children more energy when they realise this.

... Specialist Creatieve Communication

In 2005, my passion for the children’s drawing started. I followed courses at Le Bon Départ, Bauk Zwaan and a 2-year study at the Kolam (School for ‘Healing though Drawing’). In 2013, I got my degree as a Specialist Creative Communication. In 2014, I took private classes and supervision meetings with Odilia Klein-Koerkamp-Solen.

... Kids’ Skills Ambassador

In 2009, I followed the study Kids’ Skills. This is a worldwide method to see children as persons who need to learn a new skill and to not see them as persons with a problem.

... mother

In 2011, with a young daughter I searched for new challenges close to home. I combined being a mum, a teacher, and during school holidays a bicycle guide. As a family, we also love to travel by bicycle.

... teacher

In 2005 I successfully completed the PABO to get my teaching credentials for the primary school. Up till 2017 I worked as a teacher on a part time basis.

... National Guide

With lots of pleasure I followed the HBO study ‘National Guide’ for 4 years till 1995. I guided among others for Cycletours Holland, the Muiderslot castle and Bike & Barge Holland Tours. For the latter I was part-owner and responsible for tasks in the Netherlands till 2010. I still guide, it still is a passion.

 

Logo

I designed the logo based on my three fields of work.

... The drawing is represented by the paint stripes and colours. I was inspired by a book I just read by Üli Seiler-Hugova 'Colour. Seeing, Experiencing, Understanding'.

... The coaching is carried by the upside down triangle which symbolises the female, mother earth and fertility.

... The guiding can be found as the layers in landscape and culture of the Netherlands.

/artwork.content:
My artwork...

A selection of the artwork I have created myself.

/privacy.content:
Privacy

In order to be able to deliver my services, it is necessary to retain certain personal data. Below is an explanation of what information I keep and for what purpose. If this explanation is insufficiently clear, please contact me.

Personal data

To be able to make contact about appointments, I keep the phone numbers and / or email addresses that you provide. I keep these in a personal administration on my computer. Of these, daily backups are made which I personally store and which are protected against unauthorized access via encryption.

The information that is shared with me during coaching sessions is stored in a paper file. Short reports of this I share with you via email or WhatsApp on request. I will destroy the paper file one year after the last session.

To make invoices I use the online accounting package MoneyMonk. I enter the contact information you have provided, consisting of name and email address. If provided, address, postal code and place of residence are also saved, but this information is optional. Normally you will receive invoices via email. This contact information is therefore stored at and by MoneyMonk. You can read the MoneyMonk Privacy statement at the following location: https://www.moneymonk.nl/privacy-statement

I regularly make digital photos of drawings made during drawing or coaching sessions. No people are visible or recognizable, and therefore these photos can not be traced to who made the drawing. I may use these photos on my website, in newsletters and for other promotional material.

When I take photographs during drawing, coaching or guiding work where people are visible or where I want to make names known, I always ask permission for the use of the photos and / or names. Only after approval are photos and / or names then used on my website, in newsletters and for other promotional material. I do share the photos taken during group sessions with the group via email or WhatsApp.

As a promotion of my work, I regularly ask you to share your experience in the form of a review. When asking for a review I will state that this can be done both by name and anonymously. If you provide your name, it will be shown with the review you provided. This can be used on my website, in newsletters and for other promotional material.

Sharing information

My rule is, I do not share information with other parties. Exception to this rule is the sharing of information from coaching sessions with care providers at your own request. Although unlikely, but should information be ordered by a government agency for legal reasons, then I will have to cooperate.

View or change information

If you need insight into the information I keep about you and / or you would like information to be changed (modification or removal), please contact me. Also let me know if you object to the way in which I use or share information so that I can take this into account.

/reviews.content:
Reviews

    Coaching

      Guiding

website.content:
New website live!

Saturday 9 September 2017

My new website is live! Yeah! I designed the whole site myself. From now on I only teach for one day. The other days I will dedicate to drawing, coaching and guiding. I designed the logo based on these three fields of work.

The drawing is represented by the paint stripes and colours. I was inspired by a book I just read by Üli Seiler-Hugova 'Colour. Seeing, Experiencing, Understanding'.

The coaching is carried by the upside down triangle which symbolises the female, mother earth and fertility.

The guiding can be found as the layers in landscape and culture of the Netherlands.

workshop-study-day-bavinck-2017-09-19.content:
Workshop study day bavinck

Tuesday 19 September 2017

A wonderful experience while introducing the staff of the Bavinckschool to the 'Stories and Stages' of the children's drawing.

It was an interactive afternoon where all enjoyed and learned. Especially to let the children draw and not always give them colouring sheets as soothers.

Looking at drawings will be never the same for these teachers, because they know now a drawing can tell more than a 1000 words about the child!

bike-tour-waterland-2017-10-08.content:
Bike tour waterland

Sunday 8 October 2017

How fun it was to cycle around for a whole day with this lovely American couple. My honour to show and tell all about this interesting part of the Netherlands. So many stories and just as many questions. Great to be explaining the local stories, but also about the historical connections between America and the Netherlands. And not to forget the impressive eternal Dutch struggle against water. That struggle is something they were very impressed with.

The villages of Durgerdam, Ransdorp, Marken, Monnickendam and Broek in Waterland were pearls on our route!

ouder-kind-tekenen.content:
Parent child drawing workshop

Saturday 14 October 2017

Cosy, social and interesting how parent and child work together and come to a lovely art piece. It was an enjoyable project for both.

Isn't it great, a belated Father's Day present as such?

bike-tour-2017-10-10.content:
Bike tour north of Amsterdam

Tuesday 10 October 2017

A longtime wish came through. Offering tours in Hilversum where a large expat community lives. I took 9 ladies along for part of the day. Just during school hours. With the train to Amsterdam. From there we cycled through surprising parts north of Amsterdam ...

This ride through quiet and green Amsterdam North surprised all. Cycling passed Nieuwendam, Schellingwoude, Broek in Waterland and Buiksloot was a great succes. The region Waterland remains impressive with its high water levels and deep polders. Lunch in 'De Witte Swaen' in Broek in Waterland was delicious. The weather stayed dry. Up to the next tour!

news-2017-10-29.content:
New in November and December

Friday 27 October 2017

Have a look at the new activities for the coming months!

7 November: Historic city walk in down town Amsterdam (Tuesday)
28 November: An interesting bike tour in Utrecht city and east towards Amelisweerd and Fort Vechten (Tuesday).
30 November: Adult drawing workshop 'Knots' (Thursday).
8 December: A lovely city walk in downtown Utrecht (Friday).
11 December: Adult drawing workshop à la 'Hundertwasser' (Monday).

I also got some places available for coaching through drawing or MatriX method!

guiding-city-walk-amsterdam-2017-11-07.content:
Successful city walk Amsterdam

Tuesday 7 November 2017

A group of 15 enthusiastic walkers joined me on a sunny morning walk through the old parts of Amsterdam.

Discovering hidden streets, interesting historical facts and a great coffee at Droog. Let's do that again! Thank you for joining me on the first of many walks!

drawing-kids-sint-maarten-2017-11-09.content:
Sint Maarten with group 3/4

Thursday 9 November 2017

During the drawing series "Dutch holidays' we could not leave out Saint Maarten.

Totally involved the girls listened to the story of Saint Maarten. Then we started singing on paper with bee wax crayons, followed up by experimenting with colourful ecoline water colour paint. And what a surprise that after a few cuts there was suddenly a lantern!

And these lanterns have been used well the 11th by the proud artists!

guiding-bike-tour-2017-11-17.content:
Few places open: bike tour Utrecht (east) Tuesday 28 November 2017

Friday 17 November 2017

In a week and a half I will get on the bike again and guide a group to explore a part Utrecht. By quiet streets we will leave the inner city and soon ride in nature area of Amelisweerd. After a well deserved coffee stop at De Veldkeuken, we ride by fort Vechten back to the bike rental near Utrecht CS.

Like to join? Quickly book and email: contact@saskiadegroot.nl

drawing-kids-colouringbook-2017-11-17.content:
Colouring book

Friday 17 November 2017

The colouring book has been printed! It is for sale for charity: €7,50

Alice, Amelka, Evie, Marije, Juliette and Tiara have worked with pleasure making this mindfulness colouring book. All money raised wil be donated to the charity the girls chose themselves: the children's department of Tergooi Hospital.

Interested? Send me a message!

drawing-kids-sinterklaas-2017-11-30.content:
Workshop Sinterklaas

Thursday 30 November 2017

For group 3/4 this November and December months are entirely dedicated to the Dutch holidays.

Saint Maarten has already passed the review, now Sinterklaas and the next time Christmas is on the program. Today the girls have painted a background with their hands. Then painted a Sinterklaas portrait in the same three shades (and white). How well and visibly do you put yourself down? The results are beautiful!

drawing-kids-hundertwasser-2017-12-01.content:
Hundertwasser - group 12+

Friday 1 December 2017

Hunderwasser inspires with his colors, organic shapes and lines.

With markers, holographic paper, ecoline and a healthy dose of creative inspiration, the girls are busy with the completion of a winter Hundertwasser. Next week the final results!

colouring-book-explanation-8-12-2017.content:
Colouring book - explanation set up of workshops

Friday 8 December 2017

In September and October the girls (12-14 years old) worked on a colouring book. Every week another shape or line was the inspiration to creation.

You will find a repetetive set up in the colouring book. These were the assignments during the 5 workshops:
1. Put cirkels on paper and connect them with flowing lines. It is interesting to see how each brain shows different results. Eg. How full is it literally up there in the head of the creator?
2. Circles. How do these devide themselves on paper?
3. Pentagons. The 5-cornered shape is the basis of this meditative set up.
4. Animal template. What animal do you choose and how do you use the template?
5. Free choice.

All results are so different, so personal.
Lots of happy colouring!

The sales of 100 colouring books is going well. The total revenue will go to the Children's Department of Tergooi Ziekenhuis. This is a charity the girls chose themselves.

Thank you!

workshop-school-2017-12-21.content:
Drawing workshop at secondary school

Thursday 21 December 2017

It was an honour to be invited to organise an activity for Havo3 and VMBO3 students of Maupertuus in Driebergen.

After some awkward but so delightful scribbling all were ready to practice 'stromingsbeelden'. The activity slowly but surely got a lot of students hooked. Each made their own little art work or card. As an extra a creative group work was made by taking turns.
Heart warming to see the involvement especially with those who were very hesitant or shy in the beginning.

happy-new-year-2018-01-01.content:
Happy new year

Monday 1 January 2018

I wish every one a colorful and creative 2018! For me it means a total focus on 'Saskia de Groot' my own business. I stopped working as a teacher at school after more than 10 years. School has been good, but it is time for new energy!

On Thursday 11 and Friday 12 January all drawing workshops are starting again! Looking forward to 'Fairy Tales', 'Your Country , My Country' and 'Poetry' as themes.

There is one spot still open for a student aged 12-14 on Fridays from 5pm - 6:15pm! Other groups are full and do have waiting lists. So do not hesitate to contact me.

drawing-kids-2018-1-11.content:
Workshop Fairytales

Thursday 11 January 2018

The hare and the tortoise. What animal do you choose?

The girls of group 3/4 worked so well on the animal of choice in the Mexican Oaxaca style. What does that choice of animal reveal about their character?

colouringbook-donation-2018-01-16.content:
Colouringbook donation in hospital Tergooi

Tuesday 16 January 2018

What a pleasure to hand over the money that was raised by the girls for charity.

After school 5 of the 6 girls (and 4 parents :-) came to Tergooi hospital to give our money to the Children's Department. €546 +  20 colouring books + 2 boxes of quality coloured pencils + 2 pencil sharpeners. Tamara, one of the two pedagogical employees was very happy. First thing they will buy is a new football game table. The old one was broken and is terribly missed. Great purpose!!
After a photo shoot, a drink and a tour of this part of the hospital we all went home. Finishing a lovely heart warming project.

Thanks to all who bought this colouring book for charity. We sold 80 books!!

drawing-workshop-escher-2018-02-10.content:
Drawing workshop Escher

Saturday 10 February 2018

I love special requests, and certainly when two lovely mums and their daughters come to do an Escher workshop!

Escher is known for his beautiful and complex graphical work where shapes repeat and transform. The start often is the easy houses or cats, one person challenged herself by making tumbling figures. Great results, but mostly great fun and a relaxing afternoon!

citywalk-deventer-2018-02-13.content:
Succesful Citywalk Deventer

Tuesday 13 February 2018

9 am all were ready to hop on the direct train from Hilversum to Deventer.

The NS group tickets are a true gift for these kind of excursions. After arrival we had a warm coffee at Roemar in the Walstreet. Delicious apple pie and tea in a wine glass really kicked off the day with a smile. Roaming the Bergkwartier, crossing the long stretched Brink square, strolling along the high waters of the IJssel river brought us the the Lebuinus church and the price winning town hal. Some shopping in the unique streets and lunch time were followed by a smooth ride back to Hilversum. Thank you ladies for listening to the stories of gorgeous Deventer in the sun but with cold winds!

newsletter-2018-3-21.content:
Newsletter March/April 2018

Wednesday 21 March 2018

The new newsletter is out. Bike tours along the tulip fields including a visit to the Hortus Bulborum, Escher-drawing workshops for adults ...

Would you like to receive this newsletter? Please let me know: contact@saskiadegroot.nl

workshop-2018-03-25.content:
Private workshop Escher

Sunday 25 March 2018

What a cosy afternoon. 2 Mums and their daughters. Their birds, cats, flowers and Easter bunnies almost jumped off the paper! So fun to see that no one exactly knows how the result will finally look like. All results are good and it is sooo relaxing!

4 April and 9 April 'Escher animal' workshops are planned. Come and try for yourself!

lezing-2018-04-03.content:
Workshop 'Language and Drawing' for Dutch teachers

Tuesday 3 April 2018

A great morning at the International Primary School in Hilversum. I gave 3 fun workshops to the Dutch teachers during their yearly Dutch Dip's Day. All Dutch teachers gather, coming from International schools in the Netherlands. (Schools which are connected to a Dutch school).

The group 1 till group 8-teachers got many ideas how to integrate drawing in their language lessons. This will give students more freedom and will make the lessons way more fun.

workshop-2018-04-06.content:
Workshop weekly students

Friday 6 April 2018

All students this week focussed on symmetry and created flowers. The topic for the young students was 'Spring', for the older students 'Colour'.

Lots of drawing is pretty therapeutic ;-) .... Mirroring and symmetry is good to get into your own axis, improve motor skills, find balance, experience spatial orientation and overcome fear of failure!
Have a try for yourself!

walk-2018-04011.content:
Private City Walk Amsterdam

Wednesday 11 April 2018

Walking from the train station towards het Spui where we will meet, I see lots of tourist groups gathering. Big groups. A guide with a small flag or umbrella. I praise myself happy to give a private tour later on.

An American lady booked the walk for herself and her husband, passing through Amsterdam for further travels. I know her from a Bike&Barge trip two years ago. It is lovely to meet up again and roam the small streets together. At their pace, making photos, asking and answering questions, have coffee. This morning was delightful!

biketour-2018-04-17.content:
Bike tour through flower fields

Tuesday 17 April 2018

A day that went according plan. All were at 9am at the train station, the train cam eon time, the bikes of Tuut-tuut bike rentals stood ready. With sunshine we started the ride with 10 ladies. Goal: the Hortus Bulborum in Limmen.

After a few cold months the flower bulbs are starting to bloom now. A few colourful fields of hyacinths are lining up along our quiet trail to Limmen. In the Hortus Bulborum we enjoy coffee and apple pie from the local bakery. With almond paste, delicious! At 11.30am we follow Mr. Dekker through the small patches of flowers and we hear stories of old species of tulips and other bulbs. Through the fields of Egmond we cycle back to Castricum. Along the road there is a stall selling pots and bundles of flowers. Many of us end up with wonderful tulips for €1,25?! Cheap, but then we know that the growers are aiming for the bulb and not the flower.
A great day!

newsletter-may-2018-05-06.content:
Newsletter May 2018

Sunday 6 May 2018

Send me an email if you'd like to receive my newsletter May 2018.

Bike tour around Utrecht, Matrix coaching and spots available for children's drawing Workshops!

citywalk-2018-05-12.content:
Citywalk Deventer - private group

Saturday 12 Mai 2018

Coffee at Roemar in the building dating back to 1300. Then a lovely walk through the Bergkwartier, over the Brink square, along the IJssel river and around the Lebuïnus church. A wonderful afternoon with the consistory of the Protestant Community of Nederhorst den Berg. It is wonderful to guide Dutch groups with their particular interests, questions and attention!

bike-tour-2018-05-22.content:
Bike tour Utrecht

Tuesday 22 Mai 2018

A few cancellations, gray skies, a sick daughter, ... What else would bring the day? A lot of fun happily. The bike tour along the edge of Utrecht center towards the green was lovely!

The bikes are ready for us at bike rental 'Laag Catherijne'. Soon we ride past the green old city wall, through quiet streets. The 7 Alleys are beautiful, time seems to have stood still. We leave the old heart of town along the Central Museum, the Miffy Museum and the Observatory. A photo stop at the Rietveld-Schröderhuis is a must and after that we are quickly out of town. The canoe rental looks very inviting, but we follow the Kromme Rijn just cycling. The birds seem to whistle harder around Fort Rhijnauwen and the Amelisweerd forest. Meanwhile, the weather is lovely for a coffee with some goodies outside on the terrace of the organic Veldkeuken next to Oud Amelisweerd (museum MOA). With a green loop we cycle past Fort Vechten, the Roman Castellum Fectio and Lunetten back to the Utrecht Central Station. A successful cycle loop with body!

biketour-2018-06-02.content:
Bike tour Haarlem - IJmuiden - Spaarndam

Saturday 2 June 2018

Another satisfied customer! :-)
"We had a wonderful surprise family cycling afternoon around Haarlem with Saskia as private private guide. Beautiful paths and historical stories, nice lunch at a castle and an interesting tour through the information center at the locks of IJmuiden. Finishing off with a terrace on the water in Spaarndam. Everything perfectly prepared by Saskia, surprising and relaxed, a must!"

city-walk-06-14.content:
Preparing citywalk

Thursday 14 June 2018

I love it!
Sitting in my atelier, maps, books around me. A cup of tea or coffee. One historical fact or cosy street leads to another! Utrecht is so interesting and beautiful. Can we not walk for 6 hours?!

city-walk-utrecht-2018-07-04.content:
City walk Utrecht

Wednesday 4 July 2018

After a few cancellations we walked with a fun little group through the hidden gardens, alleys and history of Utrecht. Another succesful walk!

In September I will put out a new program. Please send me an email if you would like to stay updated through my newsletter.
In between you can always contact me for private tours/requests ;-).

bike-tour-2018-07-31.content:
Bike and Barge tour 'Brugge - Amsterdam'

Tuesday 31 July 2018

I fully enjoy the 12-day bike tours on board of the Angeline. What a great product!

All have their own cabin and bath room, we have breakfast on board, bike with one of the two guides, come back on board in the afternoon, have tea, a 3-course dinner, a city walk.
Isn't it great to be guiding these trips? And already for 23 years :-)

drawing-2018-07-31.content:
The Children's Drawing Workshops

Friday 13 July 2018

The Summer stop is approaching. I enjoyed the 4 groups that came to me on a weekly basis.

After the Autumn break the workshops will continue.
Again on Thursdays for group 3/4 and 5/6, on Fridays for group 7/8 an dage 12+.
New themes will lead to art pieces that are always good! We primarily work energetically and the subconsicious shows what it wants to show.

coaching-2018-09-14.content:
Matrix Coaching: instantely take out your pain or emotion!

Tuesday 4 September 2018

This month it is time to focus more on the coaching element of my work. Coaching through drawing is wonderful. In working with the child and its drawing towards a goal is so rewarding. To make the effect stronger is using the MatriX method or a mix of both.

With the Matrix method I can neutralize the core fragments of psychosomatic pain or emotions. Some emotions may find their basis in the past and are a vivid picture. Wouldn't it be nice to alter that picture in your system? Some emotions are strong and hurt your stomach thinking about it. Be welcome and try for yourself.

Often in the evening I help my young daughter to take out thoughts she does not want in her head. Thoughts that prevent her from sleeping. I'm grateful to help her in a few minutes. It is so powerful!

bike-tour-2018-09-16.content:
NEW - bike tour - audio guided

Wednesday 19 September 2018

On a regular basis I am guiding day tours. A city walk, a bike tour, together on the road with my group. I love it.
Three weeks ago I got a question: „My husband wants to take his sisters from the States on a bike trip through Holland. Just with the three of them, but actually with your expertise, tips and stories. Is that something you do?”


"Something typical Dutch, 50 to 70 km per day, 2 hotel nights, …”. It was great fun to plot out a GPS route, including the small trails because every one could follow the Dutch "bike numbers system”. Great to record the stories for carefully chosen locations. Although it is pretty weird to hear your own voice and not have direct reactions from a crowd.


Past Sunday they took off, armed with a GPS-route including marked stars with a POI (point of interest in the navigation app) for each audio-stop. My husband made a wonderful website that suggested the right audio-file according to their geo-location. The photos I received during these days showed happy people. Independent travellers, but guided nevertheless.


I felt like I send them on a treasure hunt. Which might probably be true, but in the meantime they know more about the Netherlands than my average neighbor. The bike ride to Muiden, IJburg, Marken, Edam, Waterland, de Vecht and the Utrechtse Heuvelrug proved to be beautiful.


What a great product!
Would you also like a tailor-made tour? Just let me know.

2018-10-04-coaching-matrix.content:
MatriX coaching

Thursday 4 October 2018

A week ago I left some flyers at the International Primary School. There was a coffee morning for new parents.

Yesterday I got a phonecall from a mum who was looking for help for her child. She could actualy use a peaceful tidy head herself. Today she came by. How wonderful to help her neutralize some emotions and make her head more empty. She created air for herself in her own way, accroding to her own strategies. I saw her leaving with a lighter tred. Great!

city-walk-2018-10-09.content:
City walk for the International Women Club Amsterdam

Tuesday 9 October 2018

Sweet words from a lovely group I guided through Utrecht: "Yesterday I joined a group of ladies from IWC Amsterdam for a fascinating private walking tour of Utrecht.

Our excellent tour guide Saskia de Groot took us through unknown alleys and cloisters, peaceful sanctuaries and historic buildings, relating tales of Utrecht's rich past. Glorious autumn weather, and happy friends who come from several different parts of the world made us feel so lucky to be here in Holland. An exhilarating day and fresh inspiration to paint!"

drawing-kids-2018-11-9.content:
Drawing workshops started

Friday 9 November 2018

How wonderful it is to see all of the students back, including some new faces. After the Autumn break 4 groups were eager to start again with different themes. These themes run for the whole series from break till break.

Group 4/5 - Opposites
Group 5/6 - Opposties
Group 7/8 - Animals
Group 12+ - 'Me'

Interesting to see to less I give to the kids, the more they make out of it! I am so in favour of letting the children experience a moment of no pressure, of creativity and letting their subconscious speak. And they show beautiful things!

city-walk-2018-11-10.content:
City walk Utrecht

Saturday 10 November 2018

What a great feeling again to show Utrecht to a new group. Even while shopping here regularly ... the alleys and stories were unknown. And the stone?! That one I keep for the next walk ;-).

A walk is always possible on request or wait for the next planned tour. Leiden is on my list!

Tracy: "I have fallen MORE in love with Utrecht".

city-walk-2018-11-19.content:
Preparing Amsterdam walk + scout Hermitage museum

Monday 19 November 2018

Grabbing the OV fiets and feeling the wind through my hair and sensing that freedom to roam the town. It reminds me of my student time when I studied for being a Holland Tourist Guide. Exploring towns and stories never bored me!

Amsterdam needed some research. Where can I go with a group and where is it off limits without the new guide permit for downtown? Well there is plenty to show still and I only needed to confirm what I had planned. Visiting the Hermitage museum was a lovely experience, after half an hour delay because of a fire drill. The Amsterdam panorama is beautifully set up. And looking at the Civic Guard paintings with comments of Hans Aarsman was so humourous and informative (Dutch only, English is done by other voices). Ready now for my books, the internet and a pot of tea to dive into the details a my next tour.

coaching-matrix-supervisie-2018-11-27.content:
Supervision MatriX Coaching

Tuesday 27 November 2018

Once a year small groups of MatriX coaches come together and practise, share and discuss cases. This takes place under the leadership of a regional MatriX coach. Apart from these supervision moments all coaches follow online updates to keep up the good work.

I learned a lot and enjoy it a lot!
How to help clients who are Image thinkers, who stutter, have fears, are bullied, have pains that cannot be explained...

The MatriX method remains effective, so interesting and almost magical. Try for yourself!

drawing-2018-12-13.content:
Finally!

Thursday 13 December 2018

Almost a year after we handed over our money, the football tabel arrived in Tergooi Ziekenhuis Children's Department. Yes!
A set of crockery for the play kitchen will follow.

16 January 2018:'After school 5 of the 6 girls (and 4 parents :-) came to Tergooi hospital to give our money to the Children's Department. €546 + 20 colouring books + 2 boxes of quality coloured pencils + 2 pencil sharpeners. Tamara, one of the two pedagogical employees was very happy. First thing they will buy is a new football game table. The old one was broken and is terribly missed. Great purpose!!
After a photo shoot, a drink and a tour of this part of the hospital we all went home. Finishing a lovely heart warming project.
Thanks to all who bought this colouring book for charity. We sold 80 books!!'

city-walk-2018-12-20.content:
Dutch-Canadian city walk Amsterdam

Thursday 20 December 2018

City walks. I never get enough of it. How wonderful to be invited by Rochelle to guide Amsterdam as part of her family reunion.

A part of the family left for Canada in the fifties. There they live pretty much spread out over this large country. Some family members remained in the Netherlands, some moved back here. During our meeting at Amsterdam Central Station at 9.30am I felt a little awkward to be in the middle of this lovely reunion.

I am so fond of the Oudezijds part of the city. Nowadays a guide needs a permit to guide there, I arranged this for 2019. This time we walk from the Central Station (built on sand from the dunes near IJmuiden, where engineers cut through the dunes to create the North Sea canal and sea locks), the Schreierstoren, the Lastage neighborhood, the Waterloo square, de Stopera with the NAP-point, the Old Men's gate, the Grand and the former orphanage. The story of the Miracle of Amsterdam was not forgotten. How wonderful to fascinate ex-Amsterdammers and to enjoy a coffee together at the the place where Rembrandt's painitng of the 'Syndics of the Drapers' Guild' once hung.: Hotel Droog.

From cousin Frank Bouman:
“Please thank Saskia for a renewed look at Amsterdam, with many 'secret' places and new information, I’ve never known or been before, her tour was simply marvelous!”

The “oldies” were over the moon impressed with the tour, as all ex-Amsterdamers.

drawing-kids-2019-01-11.content:
Drawing workshops 'Third Culture Kids' - 'My country, your country'

Friday 11 January 2019

This is drawing program I set up a few years ago around the theme TCK. We are doing a brief version this coming 5 weeks.
All the children participating in the workshop are Third Culture Kids themselves.
The students were born elsewhere or moved around the world. Often even with parents coming from different parts in the world. The children live in between different cultures: home, country of residence. Hence the name third culture.
There is even an online forum where adult TCK’s meet. A dynamic international life makes most TCK’s strong, easy adapters, multiple linguists etc. But they also may miss grounding, have to see friends go and often lack a feeling of belonging.

Today we looked at the world map and saw each other’s countries. Wow, many!!

With the 3 primary colours + white paint they made the country of their choice. Only using hands. Feeling.
It was a wonderful messy hour. Mixing colours till the right one was found, paint every where, very cold water when using the tap to clean hands. Proud children. We made a combined poem that will be clued on the back once the artworks are dry:

I am from Austria, where in the winter you can ski very well

I am from Poland, where the big mountains are

I am from Spain, where the ocean never ends

I am from England, where the rubbish weather is

I am from Thailand, where the sunny weather is

I am from Switzerland, where the mountains are very high and snowy

drawing-lecture-2019-01-16.content:
Two workshops for teachers STIP

Wednesday 16 January 2019

In the Fall I received a phone call from a former colleague. She was busy organizing a seminar for all teachers of STIP public schools Hilversum. The theme this year for the 400 participants was 'learning from and with each other'. How nice to be joining in as a former colleague and also be able to hear the key note speaker about 'Culture & Cognition'. Two workshop rounds followed, which included me.

A whole group of teachers has now been able to see and experience how important the drawing is and what it might tell you. A child shows so much information in his or her drawing language, which for example will never appear from a coloring sheet. The freedom to draw is sometimes even hard to adapt to for students, who are used to act within the limited lines, the boundaries of such a coloring sheet.
I make the teachers draw a house on large or smaller paper, with pencil, wax crayon or felt-tip pen. Sometimes it felt annoying or not convenient to be obliged to use what is given to you. Experience shows that each assignment requires its own material, or maybe even a free choice is desirable.
I briefly discussed the stages in the development of children's drawing to round of the workshop. Very useful for placing a child at a socio-emotionally level.

The feedback was lovely. Some teachers were captured in such a way that there will certainly be a follow up. Especially awareness has been created. My goal has been achieved!

city-walk-2019-03-01.content:
City walk Leiden

Saturday 2 March 2019

For years I already come in Leiden. For years I guide the groups of Bike & Barge Holland tours through the lovely streets and stories. But what a wonderful adventure to prepare and discover all those extra stories when you have time to cater for a few hour walk. It makes me happy, and my customers with me.

Cannot wait till next week. Then I will go again with a group of the Amsterdam International Women's Club.

I received some lovely reviews I'd like to share ...

"Leiden was full of surprises! Birthplace of Rembrandt and home to the Pilgrims, Saskia informed and looked after us so well on a great walking tour! - Liz "

"Fabulous tour of beautiful Leiden. Saskia brought the city to life, giving lots of historical background and telling such interesting stories. I thoroughly recommend Saskia as a tour guide."

"Karen Oakley - We absolutely loved the tour, Saskia. Whenever I go on holiday we always go on a walking tour of the city and some are great; some are very average. Yours was so interesting and I had such a great day! Thank you so much. Really lovely to see you after such a long time. "

city-walk-leiden-2019-03-12.content:
City walk Leiden IWC Amsterdam

Tuesday 12 March 2019

Stormy day, grey skies, but warm company and dry weather!!
The more I walk, explore and learn about a city, the more you grow to like it. Like it even more, because Leiden is a beautiful place.
But adding stories to what you see always makes a visit more intense.

Walking around with some 20 ladies of the International Women's Club Amsterdam was again a wonderful experience. We entered through the Morspoort, saw the place where Rembrandt was born, the elegant canal Rapenburg, different hofjes, small alleys, the numerous student houses with their stack of bikes in front, the old Burcht, the Pilgrims museum, the Pieters church etc. Coffee in the historical Waag restaurant warmed us up till lunch time when most joined a lunch together. A vert pleasant morning, thanks for joining ladies!

Reviews:

The tour of Saskia was very professionel. She told us about the history of Leiden and showed the places of interest.
I liked very much the Waag where we had coffee. - Maggie
 
Thank you for an amazing day - the tour was wonderful - so much to see and learn about. I’m sure we all want to go back to Leiden to explore some more, it must be beautiful in the summer. I received your email along with Saskia’s tips while still on the train home - how special is that!!
 
Yesterday I joined a group of international ladies on a walking tour of the city of Leiden (the birthplace of Rembrandt) with our lovely Dutch tour guide Saskia de Groot. I highly recommend Saskia to show you all the fascinating places, with stories that amaze. It was a biting cold, windy day, but thoroughly enjoyable. We all want to go back to explore more! - www.iwcamsterdam.nl
 
We really loved the tour, everyone was saying what a perfect balance of information and interesting stories you give! - Valerie

city-walk-amsterdam-2019-03-15.content:
Amsterdam bans guides with groups from Red Light District

Friday 15 March 2019

The AD newspaper writes: About 10 groups per hour are stopping for a story around the Oude Kerk in Amsterdam. This results in 1014 groups per week. Sometimes there are more than 48 groups per hour. Mostly these tours are focussed on the Red Light District and all the corresponding highlights. Tour groups, drunk groups of young men, just too many tourists and no one showing respect for the ladies working and inhabitants of these neighbourhoods.

I got my guiding permit this year. In 2019 I may guide groups up to 20 people through this 'zone'. A month ago I received a letter from the city council that my permit will no longer be valid till 11pm, but till 7pm. That works for me. But as of 2020 no group with guides are allowed any more. Too bad reality leads to no more walking on the gorgeous Zeedijk, over the Nieuwmarkt and along 'Our Lord in the Attic' museum. The history of this part of Amsterdam has captured my heart. So sad I cannot share that any longer in the future. That history in a nut shell and not the Red Light District is what I got my permit for. I hope that permit remains for the areas without 'windows' for the few times a year that I am there with a group. Although I do understand the problem totally.

drawing-kids-2019-04-08.content:
Drawing workshops at Maupertuus School

Monday 8 April 2019

It was wonderful to be back after more than a year at the Maupertuus school. Their location in Driebergen is green and quiet. The building is open and sunny, so is the staff.
I am here to do drawing workshops for 3 groups; the middle years, group 8 and group 7/8.
 

The students are exited and are looking forward to the art activity. The classes are small, students all have their own requirements and this workshop is a change in the standard routine. Still all are joining in wonderfully. The fun thing is always to start off scribbling, using one colour while counting down from 10 to zero. Swapping colours and go again. What a great way to relief tension, emotions and get grounded. They are ready for step 2. The first two groups cut out a vase from their scribbles. The flowers are made of infinity signs combined horizontally and vertically. This brain gym is a big enough challenge for most. The back ground is painted with a few colours of ecoline. The students love to put on aprons and create a mixture of colours with a brush. Something they don't do frequently. The vase and flowers are glued on, stims are added et voilá ... Spring time is here.

The third group made an egg from their scribbles. That egg is bursting open and shows what bird is coming out. Knowing the language of drawing it is wonderful to see the different set ups by all students, perfectly fitting their personality according to the teachers that I spoke to. It was a great morning for all.

bike-tour-2019-05-01.content:
Bike Barge tour #2 April 2019

Tuesday 7 Mai 2019

Bike & Barge organises bicycle tours for the North American market. About 12 tours a year with various destinations in the Netherlands and further. Wherever the barge 'Angeline' can sail as a floating hotel.
My luck to guide tour #2 of the season through South and North Holland - Tulip time! And isn't it amazing to learn it is my 80th tour for this company! I was surprised myself.... but after all it adds up after 1995.

Saturday 20 April all tourist boarded in the Oosterdok in Amsterdam, turning into a lovely group. Sailing towards the Amsterdamse Bos, to get away from traffic. All these days it is delightful to ride along the winding peat rivers, lakes, villages, trees turning green. And true in the meadows towards the Unesco mills of Kinderdijk, there are definitely less migrating birds to be seen than during my first rides long ago. Kinderdijk was not a good idea anyway on Easter Sunday. IT IS BUSY. Too many tourists, and of course we are tourists too. But it feels different. Exploring the country slowly on our bikes for two weeks. It feels that we belong more ... not true of course.

The tulips fields, the street organ museum in Haarlem, Koningsdag in Bergen, windy rides on Texel island, more flowers in Westfriesland and the lighthouse of Marken brought us back to Amsterdam. Like always I take the group on a city walk. Not the common Tuesday morning when I tend to be there, but a Wednesday afternoon. And yes.... we are just another group. My goodness, IT IS BUSY. The permit I have to guide downtown is up to 20 people. I have 23. So a swirl around the Nieuwmarkt zone. But even around there I get yelled at by a local cyclist: 'Maximum 5 !!'. Referring to the 5 people one may guide in the zone wihout a permit. Even while I do nothing wrong and my group is not walking on the street but on the side walk, I do feel this remark. And I understand the locals. Next time I will walk another walk that will lead tourists away from the centre but into the next neighbourhoods. Good?! Maybe we should try avoiding the crowded cities and national highlights. To feel free as a tourist cyclist normally feels, including the feeling to be welcome. Which we happily excperience 99% of the time. In September I will come again and I am looking forward to it!

2019-06-14.content:
Kinderbeestfeest 2019

Friday 14 June 2019

The Kinderbeestfeest is a yearly event that this foundation organises for families with chronically ill children. Already the 20th-edition, an anniversary for this mega-organisation. Volunteers make it possible to host a great evening for about 5000 people! An evening together, an evening that is not once dominated by that ever-present disease. I myself am already sitting at my drawing table for ten people when I hear the sirens. The streets are closed off. The red carpet is out. The families mainly come from North Holland, brought by ambulances, fire engines or police cars. That alone will make their evening! Soon after half past five the first family arrives. They want to draw. I have two assignments in mind for tonight. About animals, of course, because with the elephants, lions and lemurs as a neighbour, it cannot be otherwise. Everyone 'dances' on his or her paper with wax crayons and looks for an animal in it. Or the whole family puts a line, dot or scribble on paper that is passed on. When the paper returns to the owner, an animal is made with coloured pencil based on those signs. It is wonderful. Both the results and the atmosphere. Thankful children, relaxed mothers, fathers who disappear in their artwork. They are pulled away by the children, because there is much to experience: music ... children's yoga ... a printing press ... djembe ... and of course the zoo. An experience for me to never forget, in the most beautiful place ever. Great that my neighbour (organisation) asked me to participate!

2019-07-01.content:
Coaching

Monday 1 July 2019

Recently there was a study day for the MatriX coaches in Otterlo. Nice to see someone there from my supervision group. Under the guidance of Ingrid Stoop we go through all the routines of the method. We get impressions of how others work and can reflect on our own actions. And mine turned out to be completely fine. I still have it in my fingers. Great feeling to end the day and continue coaching in my own practice.

So far my coaching works the best by drawing and then combine the MatriX method. Example: A boy suffered from all outside influences. It came to him like a noise. I saw in his drawing that it totally controlled him (picture 1). Because he named it as a sound, he visualised/made buttons on his ears and then drew them. A volume button and a channel selection button (picture 2). He felt much more calm. When it is one at a time, he could handle it well.
It was so wonderful to see a smiling and relaxed boy in the end!

bike-tour-2-19-.content:
Bike Barge tour #12 September 2019

Friday 27 September 2019

What a luck we had. Cycling the same South- and North Holland tour as I did in the Spring. No need of rain gear for 12 days! With 26 lovely guests from all over the US, I had the pleasure to explore Holland. Right so, Holland. Holland consists of 2 provinces North- and South Holland. These 2 provinces are part of the whole country being the Netherlands. To make it easy we talk about Holland in general, just an easier word to say, a name more known abroad. But if you meet someone from Groningen province they may rightfully say, 'I am not from Holland!'

Seeing the same route this year but in two different seasons. Spring and Fall. In April we could see through gardens as the folliage was not fully out yet. Gorgeous farmhouses along water could easily be admired. In September the lush green was overwelming and gardens looked still beautiful. The large tourist groups had left, quite a relief because Easter and Tulip time do attract big crowds of people. We now had time to see other things then flowers. The King&queen at Prinsjesdag, the beach at Noordwijk, the Cruquius museum and more time for beautiful Haarlem. And the odd field of lilies were like a cherry on the pie.

city-walk-2019-11-08.content:
City walk Alkmaar, ....uh Hoorn

Friday 8 November 2019

I enjoy guiding people around, I love preparing. Stories and history parts that connect better and better. So with a head full of prepared Alkmaar facts I board the train with 11 ladies. Then the train stops in Zaandam, not going any further. There is an accident on the train tracks.

When I walk to the counter to ask for information I get an alternative route in my hands. It will be another hour traveling to Alkmaar, via Hoorn. That means a quick rushed coffee stop and a running tour. Mmmm.... . In the meantime I receive a message from home; the train will not ride till 1 pm for sure. Not handy when you promise to be home before school ends. The options I offer to the group are:
- Back to Amsterdam and walk in the Plantage neighborhood
- Onward to Hoorn
The flexible ladies opt for Hoorn.

The weather is great, clear blue skies welcome us in this formerly Zuiderzee city. We walk past almshouses, serene canals and wealthy buildings that mirror the past wealth of the United East India company. At the Rode Steen square we enjoy a coffee break in the old weighing house. An empty corner allows all 12 to snuggle in. We visit then the harbor with old and new boats, enjoy the view on the IJsselmeer lake and admire the scenic houses with their high glass windows. The eternal ship boys of Bontekoe are still sitting on a little wall, telling a beautiful story. Beautiful enough to finish Hoorn successfully and be back in Hilversum in time. Alkmaar ... see you another time!

New tours on offer!

corona-2020-03-18.content:
Corona

Wednesday 18 March 2020

A situation no one could have imagined. People sick, people dying, lock downs of countries, travellers stuck.

Happily I do not have to totally create a lock down for my business.
Yes, the last two city walks to Amsterdam are cancelled. Very sad indeed, because after the crisis I am no longer allowed to guide in Amsterdam. The permit is too expensive for my small business. I wonder now, if the city even will miss the number tourists that they were so keen on diminishing.
Yes, tullip tours are cancelled.
Yes, Bike & Barge with the bike tours have cancelled the first tours.

The drawing workshops on Thurdays and Fridays I will miss. The cheerful happy kids in my atelier. The atelier is empty now. But it will turn every week into a little art studio explaining a video assignment for the students at home. With coloured pencil or paint, on paper or carton they can then be creative after doing serious school homework. In the app group work wil be shared in whatever way. Let's hope it wil be an adequate substitute for the time being.

And for me... for the spare moments that remain after home teaching my daughter, it is time to create art myself ....a new hobby!

drawing-art-2020-04-28.content:
Corona and Art

Tuesday 28 April 2020

While being in lock down, I am lucky enough to daily take early morning hikes into the woods behind my garden.
The weather is gorgeous for weeks in a row.
With my cell phone as a camera, I walk and feel like I am doing the "I spy...' game.
Minuscule drops under flowers, the sun beams on plants under the greening trees.
The pace of these walks, the peace of mind for details, brings me a lot.
At home I finally find the patience to paint.
Somehow it is birds that fly out of my brush.

Me too, I long for normal life again.
Now I just need to see that I keep my inner focus.
It feels great!

Photos and paintings on Facebook
